Notice.definition: a notification or communication of a fact

1 a.definition: a notification or communication of a fact, claim, demand, or proceeding see also,

sub_terms.b: awareness of such a fact, claim, demand, or proceeding

1 a.note: The requirements of when, how, and what notice must be given to a person are often prescribed by a statute, rule, or contract.

1.definition: to make known through notice [appealsfor the coming session] [ashareholder meeting]

2.definition: to recognize formally [in a civil action or proceeding, the court shall instruct the jury to accept as conclusive any fact judicially"Rule 201(g)"]

constructive notice.definition: notice that one exercising ordinary care and diligence as a matter of duty would possess and esp. that is imputed by law rather than from fact [held to haveof the prior recorded deed] compare
constructive notice.constructive notice: of the prior recorded deed] compare

implied notice.definition: notice that is imputed to a party having knowledge of a fact or circumstance that would cause a reasonable party to inquire further or having possession of a means of knowing a particular fact and that is considered a form of actual notice called also

notice by publication.definition: notice published in a public medium (as a newspaper) that is used, allowed, or required esp. in matters of public concern, land, or estates or after due diligence in attempting personal service of process

3.definition: to serve a notice toto bring about by means of notice [allowed to a deposition from the other party]adjof, relating to, or being a recording act in which a party having an interest in property has priority over any earlier unrecorded claims of which the party had no notice compare,

4.definition: something (as information) that would cause a reasonable party to inquire further see alsoin this entry

5.definition: a written document containing notice [filed a of appeal]

6.definition: recognition or attention esp. by a court see alsovt
